page.title: 07LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The land around Beech Hill is slightly rolling, but flat in some places. There are some marshy areas, such as 'the Pit', but most of the land is quite fertile. There are four ponds in and around the village of Beech Hill and there are also six streams running through our area. The land itself is good for crops and livestock. It drains very well in places, but very badly in others.Ther are a couple of areas of woodland, but it is mostly open fields.
The scenery is typical of Hampshire. There is one main road (A33) which leads to Reading, all other roads are small country lanes. There are few houses. There are eight bridges and running through the southern part of our section is a Roman road called 'Devil's Highway'.
